question: You should spend about 20 minutes on this task.You are going to another country to study. You would like to do a part-time job while you are studying, so you want to ask a friend who lives there for some help.Write a letter to your friend. In your letter:give details of your study plansexplain why you want to get a part-time jobsuggest how your friend could help you find a jobYou should write at least 150 words.
text: I am writing to let you know that I will be travelling to Canada in the month of September to start my master's program at Ontario University.

Last year , I have completed my undergraduate and I was planning to study post-graduate in a foreign country. I applied to various universities in Canada and the UK. Finally, I have got an offer letter from Ontario University for Masters in Business Intelligence Program . Moreover, it is a two-year program and my parents have made the full payment of the university fees. however, I would like to cover my living expenses rather than depend on my parents. Nevertheless,as per the regulations ,  I can work only  20 hours  a week. Would it be possible for me to  find a part-time job as a data or business intelligence analyst since it relates to my current job role? Otherwise, should I find blue-colour jobs where the wages are paid hourly?
I would like you to give me some suggestions , also the practical issues faced by part-time workers.
I look forward to hearing from you soon.
